page.title: 12Liskeard Police Station
page.content: Liskeard Community Policeman,Goff White, showed us around the Police Station.It was built in 1968 and covers the area from Bolventor to Trevelmond and Menheniot to Rilla Mill.It has four cells where prisoners are kept for a short time before going to court or Exeter Prison. Thirty policemen work at Liskeard using two Panda cars ,two plain cars for C.I.D work,one large plain car for prisoners and one van.The traffic cars and police cars are kept at Bodmin but cover the area from Bodmin to Saltash. The police dogs and their handlers also work from Bodmin going wherever they are needed in the area. The station closes at night and telephone enquiries are redirected to Launceston Police Station.
